message:
Fix or suppress all warnings reported by Findbugs

This changeset has a few things:

* We switched the version of the BCEL library used by Maven for the
  "mvn site" command, due to a bug in BCEL. Previously, this bug
  preventd "mvn site" from running.
* Enabled Findbugs to run when we do "mvn site". This makes it easier
  to peruse the bug reports because we can look at the HTML. The HTLM
  is imperfect: some bugs are only properly reported in XML files. But
  it helps a lot.
* Updated the maven findbugs plugin to 3.0.3 (previously 3.0.0)
* Disabled warnings for unused fields because we had too many spurious
  warnings.
* Disabled two other warnings because we're right and Findbugs is too
  conservative.
* Fixed several warnings, including:
  - Removed unused PostProcessingSpecification from QueryTask
  - Null reference
  - Missing default in switch
  - Missing synchronization
  - Field names that had wrong case. (They're unused, so not a
    breaking change.)

This brings us down to zero warnings now.

Change-Id: I2c30d42e73e0e0ab7def79910ec8805be7ab1be1

added: // We know the file list won't be null because directory.exists() returned true,
// but Findbugs doesn't know that, so we make it happy.
